sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>sheep</radical> that's <radical>big</radical> is a true <kanji>beauty</kanji>. Big is <kanji>beautiful</kanji>, and that's all the more true for sheep.
meaningInfo:
Imagine a great big beautiful sheep. See the sheep's beauty.

This sheep is so big and fluffy that you can't see its tail, which is why it looks bit different in this kanji.
readingMnemonic: The big sheep's <kanji>beauty</kanji> has attracted a swarm of <reading>bee</reading>s (<ja>び</ja>). The sheep is so beautiful that the bees have mistaken it for a flower.
readingInfo: The bees are swarming around the sheep, marvelling at its beauty and trying to figure out how to get nectar from it.
